Record.ClassificationPath: Chemicals_and_Drugs_Kind/Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material/Pharmacologic Substance/Biological Response Modifier/Vaccine/Antineoplastic Vaccine/RASVAC-C
Record.BroaderTerm: Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material
Record.Description: A synthetic vaccine used for cancer immunotherapy also known as Ras(cis 12)-Vaccinia Vaccine, RASVAC-C is based on a mutant peptide epitope of the Ras oncoprotein at codon 12 that induces recognition and induction of tumor-specific, cell-mediated immune responses. Ras is an intracellular GTP-binding protein involved in signal transduction and regulation of proliferation and differentiation. (NCI04)
